runs.comm: shortish ball angled across the batsman, whose feet stay stoic at the crease as he dabs the ball to point
waft and miss, and its his footwork, or lack of it that prevents him from meeting the full length ball outside off with an airy drive
played close to his body as Morkel returns to his staple short of a length. Jamshed guides it off an open face behind point to deep third man
lots of bounce as per usual for Morkel as Shehzad watches this back of a length ball through to the keeper
shuffles a tad bit back and across as he rides the bounce on that back of a length ball outside off stump to cover
and the inswinger is clipped off middle. Dale Steyn lets the ball squirt through his dive and Shehzad is off the mark as well
he does it again. The extra cover gap lures Jamshed into a drive on the up as he slants the ball on a fullish length across the batsman
tighter line and length and Jamshed commits the same mistake. Length ball just outside off and he goes for a limp drive, missed again
much better. He employs a defensive bat to the length ball on off. Jamshed has his head right over the ball, but his feet go nowhere.

oh, was that a catch?! No the edge falls well short of AB at second slip. Full length ball inviting the drive and Steyn is successful in his search. There is a direct hit at the striker's end and as it ricochets away, Pakistan take a single
full, outswinger on off stump as he covers the line and defends off the back foot
teasing delivery outside off and it shapes away as well, but Shehzad ignores it
that thuds onto the bat as Jamshed goes for another drive on the up. The bat face turns and it scurries away behind point for the first boundary. Jamshed may well have left his feet back in the shed
tighter on off stump with a good length ball. Jamshed stays back to block
short ball outside off stump, but Morkel generates a little more bounce than he expects and his cut shot slashes well below the ball as it goes to the keeper
tiny little feather and it runs away to the right of the keeper for the second four of the over and the innings. Wrong line from Morkel and his short of a length deliveries
shortish and on the pads again as he tucks it away off the hip to deep fine leg.
not too much initiative from either batsmen to get on the front foot. This is full on off and Shehzad is stuck in his crease as he presents a straight bat
what a shot! It was nowhere near short for the shot as Steyn invests in an offcutter, but he had opened up his stance and smeared it through straight midwicket
full length on off stump but those subcontinent wrists come into play as he whips it away through square on the leg side
142 kph, cross seamed delivery elicits a timid waft of the bat. He was consciously going leg side of the back of a length ball just outside off stump and is beaten comfortably
just short of a full length as Shehzad whips it towards mid-on from the back foot
short ball from Steyn and this has been dispatched! Sat up quite nicely for Shehzad and he pummels it over deep midwicket. It seems this wicket is a little slower than Jo'burg

good length ball with a little width, which Shehzad exploits as he pulls into the leg side. As Shehzad makes his ground at the non-strikers' end, the stump mic picks up some choice words from the bowler. Though not sure who it was directed at

and he strikes straight away as he nicks it to the only slip. It was back of a length angled across the right-hander who goes for the flash outside off. Gets thick edge and it looked to be sailing to the third man boundary, but Hashim Amla leaps full length skyward and plucks it out
drives away from his body as Parnel angles the length ball across him. Beaten first up
looked to pull that length ball on middle, but it came on too quick and he had to bunt it over to mid-on
flicked to midwicket as Parnell holds a steady line on middle
times that well, but it goes straight to the fielder at cover. Nice and full and if he had played that a little straighter, he would got a lot more
144.8 kph, back of a length on off stump to finish the over and he keeps it to a wicket-maiden as well. Hafeez goes back and blocks into the off side
starts off with a full, floating ball outside off which is driven through the man at cover. Phangiso would be disappointed with his effort there
clipped away rather smartly towards deep midwicket as Wiese keeps it full and homing in on middle
flays it to cover, but he can't find the gap. Fullish ball angled across the left-hander again
and he makes up. Jamshed was trying to walk at that, but the bowler dug it in a little short. Nonetheless he rode the bounce and punched to cover where Phangiso keeps it to a single
pulled down into the ground, good shot that as Wiese gets this one to rise about stomach high after he saw Hafeez advancing. Deep fine leg mops up
shortish ball to complete the over as well, with Hafeez moving onto his back foot to block
145 kph, whipped to deep midwicket from outside off as he goes back to negotiate this back of a length delivery
cardinal sin there from Parnell. This was on a length just outside off stump as Hafeez plays it to deep third man with soft hands. Giant no-ball as well

free hit bouncer on middle and it clatters into the stands behind square leg and he adds a query whether it was above head high. It wasn't, mate, but that was an excellent hook shot. This time he had no intention of keep it down
full lenght, but this rises enough to get the splice of the bat as he was looking to punch down the ground
full and outside off stump as he strides confidently forward and drills it to extra cover
pick-up shot from leg stump, and this goes well in front of square. Hafeez seems to be gauging this ball quite well as Miller runs around to protect the boundary
tucks it off his pads to deep square leg to retain strike. I get the feeling spin is going to come on soon
charges him first ball as he meets it at its pitch the drive powerfully straight down the ground

success straight away as he sees the batsman charging him and fires this wide outside off and de Kock finishes things off with a flourish. Jamshed was well and truly done in there as the South Africans are overjoyed
tossed up outside off and he leans forward to steer it away to point
pushes it through on middle as Akmal gets forward and nudges it towards square leg to get off the mark
drifts in towards the pads as hafeez comes forward and looks to defend, but he only gets pad
de Kock twists his body like a pretzel as he expresses his disappointment at Hafeez managing to sweep this fullish ball on leg stump
doesn't spin and the batsman was expecting it to as he was late on the cut shot, even though it was shortish and the angle gave enough room
drags that from outside off stump with a pull shot through midwicket. Too short from JP again
another similar flat-batted strike, this time going down to long-on for a single
tosses it up wide of off stump and Akmal square drives it to deep point
not quite full, but not short either as Hafeez waits for it nicely and dabs it away with soft hands to third man, who was inside the circle, but the run well
forgets his disciplne, does the part-timer as the short and wide ball is smacked through point. he does have protection there though
pulls out the late cut, but JP at point dives to his left and keeps that to a dot
gives room, gives the proper length to play the perfect late cut as this time Hafeez beats short third man on his left and away she goes
Steyn has to get his skates on and as he tumbles over to save the boundary. It was full and wide this time and Hafeez unfurls the perfect cover drive. Yes, you heard me. Hafeez
flighted on middle and is nudged it behind square on the leg side
Akmal goes one better as he runs the full length ball to the left of fine leg to pick up another single
looking for two, but it was not on. Flighted on middle but he stays back to flick it towards the midwicket region
oh, he is motoring alone. The line did help him out there, but he met the ball well with a lovely little leg glance and it scurries away in a flash to the fine leg boundary
short and asking to be slammed, the batsman obliges with a rasping pull shot but the man on the square boundary keeps it to a single
slower ball, off cutter, almost dupes him, but Akmal adjusts as he waits in his stance and defends
another slower length ball, I think, and this one has enough room for him to work it away to third man
full but still has ample room for him to drive through the covers
looks for an easy dab to third man, but the ball which was on a length and angled into him gets enough cut to beat the bat
more use of the feet and this time it gives maximum dividents. Lifts it over the head of the bowler with a full swing of his bat. Clean strike
and another one! Advances again and reaches the pitch and goes through with his shot as he should have, and savours it as it thuds into the stands over long-off
tossed up on leg stump as he leans forward and turns it to square leg

and Akmal joins in. There isn't too much spin on this wicket and both batsmen seem to be aware of that fact as he, despite reaching the pitch of the ball, goes through with the shot and gets it over the long-on boundary
but he strays on the pads, which the batsman is happy to tuck away to fine leg
tosses it too wide of off stump and the batsman is only too content to cut the ball away to deep third man
and thats fifty to Hafeez and the partnership as Duminy's woes with the ball continues. This was a full toss on leg stump and he sweeps it away powerfully
full and wide again as he flays it through to deep point
AB dives full length to cover the line of that back foot punch and saves some runs there. It was a length ball angled across the batsman
whips it away on the other side of the wicket, but Faf is there to cut it off this time. Two dot balls to end the over

and he is greeted with a smart late cut. That wouldn't help Steyn's temper, the ball was short and wide enough for the batsman to get it just fine of the short third man, where Steyn was. He does his best to cut it off, diving full length to his left but it is in vain
and this time he gets a thick edge while looking to drive on the up and would have gone straight to Steyn, had he been inside the circle
Akmal shuffled right across his crease and Wiese's line consequently went even wider outside off and it is dabbed to third man again
full toss, well wide of off stump but Hafeez had premeditated the sweep and it squirts away to deep square leg
length ball, with some width on offer and he stands up and swats it straight down the ground. Amla is not quick enough to stop that at long-on
goes for the wide yoirker, but Akmal goes down with it and steers it away to third man. Very productive region that's become
thumped straight to extra cover as Morkel bowls it short of a length just outside off. Faf might have got that in the box. Ouch

he had line that up the minute Morkel pitched it up. Went right back in his crease and then propelled his weight forward to covert an almost-yorker to a half-volley and simply smashes it straight over the top
and that stroke sets up this one as he goes across to the off side and laps it to the fine leg boundary. Great improv there
oh, that was murdered over point. Short, wide and Akmal just demolished that with a cut shot that did not know the meeting of "soft hands"
oh and Morkel tries to keep him quiet with a wide, fullish ball, but he has sprayed that a little too outside off stump
wide, fullish ball again as he just about reaches it and slaps it away to deep point

and its Hafeez this time. The full and wide line doesn't work against him either as he goes down on one knee and flays this to the right of backward point. It was hit uppishly, but placed well enough to go to the boundary
deals up a full toss on middle and Hafeez almost seems surprised as he blocks it back to the bowler
another full toss comes out in his search for the block hole as Hafeez gets down on one knee and slogs it to deep long on
and even when it doesn't hit the bat, Pakistan find a run. Speared in on the pads and he plays all around that one, but as the ball meanders off, the pick up a single
horrid ball that. South Africa are well and truly rattled as Parnell bowls a full toss to about the tenth stump outside off
length ball and Akmal says thank you as he gets underneath it and sends it into orbit. He admires the strike, as it sails over the straight boundary
wide yorker, but Akmal manages to reach it as he steers the ball off the open face of the bat to the point boundary.
full length ball on and around off stump which the batsman pushes to mid-off and scurries for a single
and he starts off with an off cutter. Dupes Akmal completely as he cannot adjust to the change of pace. His dab to third man ends up a play and miss
this time he was ready for the change-up, chopping the length ball with a little bit of width to deep third man

that should be out and is. AB is not going to drop those and Steyn has a wry little smirk. It was just back of a length, striking him high on the bat as he was looking to slam the ball straight over the top. Ends up giving a simple skier to mid-off. But I daresay, Hafeez should be the one smiling after that knock
fine leg was in the ring and that short ball takes a thick edge and runs off for a one-bounce four
change of pace again and with the ball wide enough, he dabs it to third man for a single
and he in his inimiatble style tries the whip the full length ball on off stump through leg but only gets a leading edge. The bowler sticks his right hand out but it was just a little too wide
goes for the almighty heave, and comes up with a whole lot of air. Poor batting from Afridi
another length ball, and again he goes to the leg side and tries to pummel it out of the ground. No dice
full and wide outside off, Afridi is on his front foot to play the flay through covers, but he can't reach it
fullish length ball and it could have been slammed through the off side, but Afridi has not gauged the line of that well enough as he goes for another airy drive
this time it is a full toss and he slaps it away to deep point as the bat face turns on impact
digs it in again, slower bouncer, as Akmal stays on his back foot and dabs it to point
and another appalling play and miss from Afridi. He had moved outside leg and this was short just outside the off stump. Had he stayed still, it would have been an easy put away

full on off stump, but the ingenuity of Akmal trumps ensures Pakistan get four off that. Knew it was going to be full on the stumps as he moves outside off and laps it over fine leg. Had his eyes on the ball even as it met the bat
full length ball with a little bit of width as Akmal drives that strongly square on the off side
that was in the slot, length on middle and Afridi smacks it one bounce to long-on
oh that's his second of the night and it will be Afridi on strike next ball for the free hit. This was full length on middle and he pushed it to long-on

free hit and it yields only a leg bye as Parnell bowls a bouncer off the back of his hand. Afridi was through his pull shot an age too early and gets it on the forearm as it dribbles away on the off side
equals his highest T20 score as he goes for a short ball around head high. Doesnt get all of it and so it falls short of the man in the deep
his front foot was making way for another wild slog, but this one was just too high

short and at the body, no room for him to work with and Afridi in such woeful form gets a top edge. Thankfully for him (or is it?) it lobs past the bowler and doesn't travel far enough for mid-off to get under it
138 kph. another wild slot, another play and miss another length ball not taken advantage of as Umar screams for the other end for Afridi to get a single
139 kph, as awkward as ever Afridi was making room outside leg, Steyn followed him with a fullish ball which takes the inside edge, sneaks through his legs and runs away for four
this time he gets an outside edge while staying firmly leg side of the shortish ball as he looks to cut it

oh, JP has pulled off as screamer and Akmal's innings ends as he goes for the big shot down the ground. Length ball, but with Steyn's extra pace, he doesn't time the ball as well as he wanted it. Long-on rushes in from the deep, dives forward and clings on to a swirler
oh, was that wide? No says the umpire as Afrid was moving outside leg. It was a fulish ball just inside the wide line

Steyn is filthy with himself as Afridi manages the end the innings with a streaky boundary. It was shortish and angled in at the batsman, who goes for a thoroughly unconvincing pull shot, which comes out a top edge and runs away
